background: A flooring company produces engineered hardwood and vinyl planks.
constraints: Square feet of hardwood to be produced weekly is at least MinHardwood
Square feet of vinyl to be produced weekly is at least MinVinyl
Total square feet of flooring to be shipped weekly is at least MinTotalShip
Square feet of hardwood to be produced weekly is at most MaxHardwoodProd
Square feet of vinyl to be produced weekly is at most MaxVinylProd
Square feet of hardwood produced weekly is non-negative
Square feet of vinyl produced weekly is non-negative
objective: Maximize the company's profit from hardwood and vinyl planks produced weekly
description: A flooring company produces engineered hardwood and vinyl planks. Their sales forecasts show an expected demand of at least \var{MinHardwood} square feet of hardwood and \var{MinVinyl} square feet of vinyl planks each week. To satisfy a shipping contract, a total of at least \var{MinTotalShip} square feet of flooring must be shipped each week. Due to a labor shortage issue, no more than \var{MaxHardwoodProd} square feet of hardwood and \var{MaxVinylProd} square feet of vinyl can be produced weekly. If a square foot of hardwood flooring yields a profit of \var{ProfitHardwood} and a square foot of vinyl planks produces a \var{ProfitVinyl} profit, how many of each type of flooring should be made weekly to maximize the company's profit?

parameters.definition: Minimum demand of hardwood per week
Minimum demand of vinyl planks per week
Minimum total square feet of flooring required to be shipped per week
Maximum hardwood production capacity per week
Maximum vinyl production capacity per week
Profit per square foot of hardwood
Profit per square foot of vinyl
